description: JB's. What can I say. I don't think I've ever loved a hole in the wall restaurant more in my life. The owner is amazing. The staff is nice. The food, the food....you just can't go wrong with any option. Affordable and yummy. In San Francisco ?! What more can you ask for. Only open til 4 M-F so get in where u can
author: Helen S.

description: Super friendly staff! Big portions. Can't go wrong with this place. My favorite so far is the grilled steak  sandwich.
author: Winnie B.

description:
I ordered the spicy buffalo chicken sandwich.  It would have been tasty except it was soooo salty. So salty that even though I drowned the chicken with mayonnaise it was still too salty to eat. 

I really want to like this place. The cashier (and owner?) was kind and welcoming. Ok JB, I will come back one more time but please try the food before it goes out to your customers!
author: Sheewon B.

description: A little hole in a wall but the breakfast is smackin delicious and great service I had the JB Deluxe on a Dutch Crunch roll.
author: Sergio M.

description:
Great Rueben, really fast service. 
Wanted breakfast but was a bit too late (they stop at 11:00), but serve a bacon&egg sandwich the rest of the day
author: Trent W.

description:
This is our company's go to breakfast spot in Potrero Hill. The owner, Nasir, is very customer-centric, takes time to learn people's names and his staff is extremely friendly. Food is great as well -- hard to beat it for the price!

10/10 would recommend to a friend.
author: Blake M.

description: A simple neighborhood breakfast/sandwich shop. The staff here a friendly and welcoming. Has a small space for seating. No frills place, walk up order you sandwich/food and be on your way. They do serve hot sandwiches/burgers/hot dogs along with daily specials of stews or soups. Prices are reasonable. It's a standard average sandwich shop, I wouldn't go out of my May to come here but if I were nearby and hungry it wouldn't be a bad option
author: Peter P.

description:
Great place for working class folks.
Prices are reasonable.  Not really accessible for children and strollers.
I'll have to go back and try their lunch.
author: Candace W.

description: The spicy chicken buffalo is disgusting.  Fries were old and chicken was cold. It was a hot damn sandwich! Two stars because he gave me my money back. Thanks again!
author: Markell P.

description: Best customer service on this side of the Mississippi. Mr. JB's is a heck of a man!
author: KT D.

description: I've been eating here 1 to 4 times per week for the last 5 months, since my company moved to the neighborhood.  JB's gets a lot of my lunch business because it's literally the closest restaurant to my office.  Staff is very friendly (I suppose being a regular helps!) and the sandwiches are good.  They also have some hot specials every day, so check the board.  They are quite good.  I've had the fried shrimp, the spaghetti, fettuccine alfredo with chicken, pesto salmon, a few others.  The hot lunch specials come with a side salad.  I usually get a cold sandwich; they have all the meats (ham, turkey, roast beef, mortadella, pastrami, etc.) and all the fixins (lettuce, tomato, sprouts, mayo, mustard, pickles, various cheeses and breads to choose from.  Sometimes I'll get oil and vinegar on my sandwich to make it taste all east coasty.  They also have a variety of burgers and hot sandwiches including meatloaf (which is cold by request, if you like) and chicken breast sandwiches.  And OMG their fries, which come with the hot sandwiches, are delicious, always very hot and crisp.  They also serve breakfast (the sausage for their breakfast sandwiches is super delicious) and have a bunch of fresh baked goods (muffins, donuts) if you just need to grab and go.  JB's doubles as a convenience store, with several large wall coolers filled with beverages and a counter stacked with candy and chips.  This is particular useful because when I worked downtown there was always a Walgreens or 7-11 nearby and now there isn't; for a quick 3pm snack there is really only JB's in the area.  Overall I love this place but one of my co-workers and I agree that their chicken salad is terrible.  Avoid.  But I really like everything else, and have been very happy with their service and smiles.
author: Dave M.

description: Holy cow this place is awesome. I'm working a construction sight across the street and i have to eat here every day because its amazing. Best Ruebin Sandwich I've ever had
author: Mathias A.

description:
Love this place! I first learned about this place about 20 years ago when I attended a school nearby. They were great then and great now! 
The prices are reasonable and the owners are very friendly and personal! 
Lately I have been getting JB's salad with options to top it off with different salad concoctions (i.e. ceviche, falafel salad, grilled chicken breast, avocado, tuna salad, devil's egg etc).  The grilled chicken is so good, soft and flavor is just right! They give good recommendations if you are indecisive! They do catering too! They specialize in sandwiches but they have other homemade specials. Love the homemade chili beans with meat.. it has the perfect spice! Their fries are popular too! 
Definitely worth coming back to!
author: Heidi B.

description: My go-to during the week, the meatloaf special and the coffee, top notch.  All the guys are super friendly.  Opens super early at 5:30.
author: Kevin L.

description: Great lunch options in the Potrero hill area. The owner Nasir is a great person and is always taking care of customers. I love this place and the people who work there are amazing.
author: Jam R.

description:
Really nice people, the portions were great and just a really nice place to go for lunch.

It's super clean, has a bathroom and is cute.
author: Candy M.

description: Great, small breakfast spot in the area, especially since there's not much to choose from. Good, homemade breakfast and fast service. Usually pretty crowded before 8 AM because of the construction workers, but if you call ahead, you can pick up your breakfast and get it to go. The owner is friendly and so are the workers and I've never had anything bad here.
author: Crystal K.

description:
JB's Place is a family owned staple in the Potrero Hill neighborhood. This little place has been here for decades and refuses to change like everything else in the hood. Just around the corner from Jackson park and walking distance from the Anchor Steam brewery and what was formerly Potrero Hill Middle School (now ISA).

Serving up everything from incredible breakfast plates, sandwiches and burritos to deli sandwiches (get the dutch crunch, it's amazing), hearty salads and daily lunch specials. All done with love and care like you are being served by your own family. If you come in often you will be greeted by name and the staff will remember your standard order and will hit you with a "would you like the usual" when you enter. Kinda like a deli version of Cheers. 

Do yourself a favor and order a breakfast burrito, you will NOT be disappointed! Wishing the owners and staff nothing but the best, keep up the great work and PLEASE KEEP DOING WHAT YOU HAVE BEEN FOR YEARS!  Too much has changed on the Hill in the past decade and the locals need to continue to support the handful of businesses that have been around since the 80's.
author: Josh H.

description:
JBs Place is a cool deli/diner tucked in ok the back side of Potrero Hill.  The dining room is very clean, they have a fully stocked display case with a variety of beverages. 

I ordered an omelette with home fries, and they were accommodating since it qas at the breakfast cut off time. While we were ordering, we noticed they were making fresh ceviche. It looked so tasty, I want to come back some weekend to try it.

This place has plenty of items on the menu, and serves breakfast and lunch with drip coffee always ready to go! I recommend it next time you near Potrero Hill.
author: Marlon T.

description: Was in the neighborhood around lunch time and stumbled across JBs. It's a no frills place, but that's exactly what I want in a neighborhood deli. I got a tuna melt, but they have a good variety of sandwiches and deli salads. I was happy to see that they had a good variety of beverages & snacks; in true San Fran fashion I got a strawberry Kombucha and Avocado Oil Himalayan Salt chips. Sandwiches are made to order, so there could be a bit of a wait, but my sandwich was pretty solid and filling. There is enough seating inside and out, plus the park is next door if you wanted to do a picnic. Glad I found this place.
author: Allison T.

description: I love this place! Workers are friendly and the food is always good and fresh! Perfect for lunch or dinner. Try the chicken panini! The daily specials always look really good.
author: Kris E.

description: Best breakfast burrito in SOMA...hands down.  I get the Veggie Breakfast burrito without papas and add BACON of course.  So I get some healthy veggies and some fattening meat.  Mucho gusto!  The sandwiches are big and salads are on point too.  Soccer games are always on, but too bad they aren't open on weekends or holidays.
author: Michelle H.

description: Had a meeting near Jackson Park and popped in for a deli sandwich. I was blown away! Great price point, great service and great food! Happy to of found this gem!
author: Brandy R.

description:
I work in Portero Hill and this is the best go-to lunch spot in the area for reasonably priced, out-of-this world, tasty salads, sandwiches, and breakfast burritos.

Their Chicken Caesar Salad is freakin' fantastic! Do yourself a favor and order a large with everything in it. You won't be disappointed with the mouth-watering pieces of grilled chicken - lightly browned on the outside, juicy on the inside, and grilled mushrooms, onions and bell peppers soaking with savory goodness. Say "yes" to the Parmesan cheese and you've got yourself the best damn salad anyone could wish for. You don't even need the dressing. It's THAT good. Oh, and did I mention the portion size? It's huge! You'll be stuffed from a large. I typically split it into 2 meals. Not bad for $9.

Also, the folks who work here are awesome. You'll want to come back again and again for their super friendly, fast service in addition to their amazing food.
author: Katherine Y.

description:
Solid sandwich spot in the Potrero Hill neighborhood
Spot has to have been here for years serving all of us working or living in the neighborhood with great breakfast & lunch choices
Order line and service is prompt and courteous
How can one go wrong with real good Dutch crunch rolls
author: vince r.

description:
GREAT breakfast burritos. And super affordable, especially for this neighborhood. I haven't tried anything besides the bfast burritos, but I have tried the vegetarian and the ham&egg&cheese, both great! The rest of the food always looks delicious. Fried shrimp, tri-tip, deviled eggs, can't wait to go back and try!

Breakfast ends at 11am!
author: Naimah M.

description:
Ive been hearing great reviews before coming here, so i decided to try them and Im so glad that I did! . They have a great variety of food for breakfast, lunch but I must say their chicken ceaser salad is so good, on top of that it is served hot. Please try it,  you will love it! 

Great customer service, they are very nice and make you feel welcomed
author: Alyce S.

description: Chicken Caesar salad. Pure ecstasy. I'm surprised this place doesn't have a Michelin star yet. Unfortunately, JB's is closed on weekends, otherwise I would eat here 7 days a week.
author: Matt S.

description:
JB's place is my favorite go-to place for lunch when I'm at work!  The people that work there are very friendly and personable.  The food comes out fast and is very delicious :)!

Get the chicken Caesar salad
author: Wes L.

description: Seriously the most reliable best little deli ever. I get a sandwich here almost every day, so good and consistent. I have also gotten several catered trays, also amazing and they were so accommodating. Can't express enough how much I love their food and their service and all the people there.
author: Teresa G.

description: I use this business to provide lunch for a camp run for middle school students. I called in with a last minute order for 25 people and they graciously accommodated the order. The sandwiches used fresh ingredients and the kids loved all the sandwiches. I ordered the shrimp Caesar salad which was amazing and had high quality shrimp and you could tell that it was freshly made that morning. I thank JB's for providing  quality food at a low cost that's affordable for a camp and enjoyable for kids. I will most definitely be using their services and enjoying their food again.
author: Prescott R.

description: This place is great! They have fresh salads that are super delicious. I also ordered sandwiches here. This is one of the best places in the city to eat at lunch. Friendly staff and clean.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Great food. Good service. The only complaint is that the line is a bit long/slow during lunch time, but that's to be expected when the food is this good. Plus the staff is super friendly and it seems to me that they're working as fast as they can.
author: John M.

description: This place rocks. Good food and good people. I love getting the cheese burger here. I love combing here. They also know my name. I also love that this place has free WiFi. I would like to see more JB's Place locations. It would be also nice if they accepted Apple Pay.
author: Isaac H.

description: So it was my first time and out of town. I'm a home chef and like to think that I know good food... So I used yelp to help me and they did. I had the grilled steak sandwich add tomatoes and lettuce and it was pretty damn good plus it looked like they had many other great sandwiches :) cheers
author: Jimmie J.

description: I probably eat here once a week. I'm a picky eater and they naturally make my sandwiches to perfection. Fun and friendly staff, its always super clean, and the only thing I would change is the hours- they close SO EARLY!
author: Brittany S.

description:
I'm borderline devastated that I've worked three blocks away from JB's for over three years, and I have JUST NOW come here for a sandwich.  

Amazing sandwich.  It was like, everything that I want in between two slices of bread.  And FYI - their Dutch Crunch is the best.  It's crispy on top and soft and chewy throughout - not like pretty much the rest of San Francisco's sad offerings of the type.  Also, thank you for being generous with the mayo and mustard.  I hate a dry sandwich!

Future lunch customer 4eva.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
After running some errands the other day I was looking for a sandwich place and JB's Place came up so I thought I'd give it a try.  Warning that parking might be difficult around here depending on the time you stop by.  Luckily I found a spot relatively close.  I had read about the Spicy Buffalo Chicken Burger so that's what I got and I was pleased with it.  I would say that it lacked on the spicy part but it was really tasty and the fires were really good as well.

Good spot for a quick, quality lunch.
author: Blake B.

description:
At first I thought it was an abandoned business from years ago. Commonly walking by in the evening, this "JB's Place" that often popped up on my Yelp searches seemed elusive. It took me many months before I read the business hours and learned they were open for breakfast & lunch. Then I made a point to try it out. 

Simply put, this is a place you will eat at often once you've been here once. A feel of a diner meets corner store, they specialize in specials. Every day is an adventure with what they'll highlight. And I'm not just talking about a new sandwich, I'm talking about straight up home style meals like chicken fried steak, mashed potatoes and salad or Mediterranean salads.

The sandwiches you ask? Oh yes, these are tasty. Plenty of meat options. Plenty of veggie options. And an array of salads to take on the side if you want to skip the chips or just go big for the day. 

If you're local, you'll already be a regular. If you're close by and wondering if it's worth the jaunt, yeah, it is.
author: Darin A.

description:
My wife and I frickin' love this place. We get breakfast and or lunch there whenever we're around Potrero Hill, and EVERYTHING tastes good. 

Plus, the staff and owners are all SUPER friendly, actually care about there craft, and always check they get your order right. I like to sit down and watch the morning news  over a hot breakfast inside, or if it's sunny, there are a couple of tables outside too. Then sometimes, I'll pick up a sandwich to-go and be sorted for my lunch. Prices are oddly inexpensive, I never quite figured out why but I'm not complaining. 

My only complaint is that JBs closes early, I think at 4pm, but I get that too. The staff look like they actually have a life and enjoy their work, probably because they DON't work 18 hours a day. 

Keep it up, we'd buy the t-shirt if there was one!
author: Ian S.

description:
I'm always on the lookout for a great burger, and I found one just a few days ago at JB's Place on Potrero Hill.  I've wanted to try JB's for quite sometime, but whenever I'm in the area during the noon hours the place is usually super-packed.  Whenever I've gone later (around 3 PM) they're getting ready to close up shop.  I guess it was around 2 PM when I stopped in the other day.  There were just a handful of customers inside at the time.  I walked up to the sandwich counter, was greeted by a friendly hello, grabbed a menu and studied it.

Bacon cheeseburger?  Maybe.  Avocado cheeseburger?  Sounds good too!  The JB Burger - double bacon avocado cheeseburger!  Oh my!  Yes, I'll have that!  All of JB's burgers come with a massive order of shoestring fries on the side.  I placed my order and paid for it along with a soda at the cash register where I was greeted by another friendly hello.  The wait wasn't too bad either as my burger and fries were ready to go within ten minutes.

Not only did I get a humongous portion of fries in the take out box, but the sandwich itself was huge too (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bJNVd1HqilRD3F9RO3t20g?select=PUtDBz_likDKx2zeV1jrhA).  It's not always just the juicy, flavorful beef patties but often it takes a combination of things to make a great burger.  The JB Burger was drip all over my hands delicious.   Piled high on a soft and chewy sandwich roll were two hamburger patties, two slices of cheese, several slices of tender-seared bacon, thick tomato slices, super thin rings of red onion, crunchy pickle coins, creamy ripe avocado and shredded lettuce.  As I bit into the burger and juices ran down both of my hands all of these ingredients screamed out, "This is an incredible burger!"

JB's is a bit of a hike from my workplace, but with a burger this good I'm definitely adding this restaurant to my lunch rotation.  The restaurant serves up breakfast until 11 AM and has an extensive list of sandwiches, burgers, soups and salads.  I've scanned and posted their current menu in the photos section.  The dining area inside consists of two seaters and bigger tables that can be parked together for a group.  There's limited seating outside too.  The friendly staff is very accommodating.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: So I went into JBs for the first time today with a friend. I'm not gonna lie, when I walked in, I was a little iffy about the place. Seemed like it was set up like a convenience store restaurant. All I've heard were good things so we went ahead and ordered. I had the patty melt and my friend had a burger. Oh my goodness, they were both amazing!! I would definitely recommend this place to any of my friends.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I work in the hood. We have lots of options, but JB's get my money. 

It's not fancy -- the food is just plain good and they have a wide variety of options. The perfect spot for the everyday.
author: Justin M.

description:
Oh JB's.  How I heart you and your hot lunch specials and cold pasta salads.

This is a small, down to earth deli/lunch joint.  No extra frills, no crazy shenanigans, just great, solid fare for which I don't have to pay an arm and a leg.  I work down the street, so when I don't feel like trekking up the hill because I forgot my lunch, JB's is my standard go-to place.

They have all the sandwich combinations you could want (though their liverwurst oddly isn't my favorite), a decent selection of burgers, and *great* lunch/brunch options.

Honestly, their French Toast could (and has in the past, really) keep me happy and satisfied, and maple syrup-dazed from the very first bite all the way through to when I realize that dinner time has come around and maybe a salad is the way to go.

It does get crowded and a bit noisy come lunch time, but off hours it's surprisingly nice to go in and just sit and read (according to my friend who had the time to do so back in the day).

Omnomz , guys.  Just. Omnomz.
author: Emilynne A.

description: Great little breakfast spot in the morning.  Super friendly staff. Almost I go there everyday for my meal to get me going
author: Sei W.

description: JB's!!!!! Love this place! This place takes care of my breakfast cravings! Great breakfast and lunch place! Great service and good hearty food!!! Coffee is great, eggs any style with bacon and hash browns are a must when getting breakfast here! If you're looking for some great food at an affordable price JB's shouldn't disappoint!
author: J M.

description: Love this place. Chill people, great food, nice neighborhood feel.
author: Eric F.

description:
I'm excited cuz its  one of the few places that serve Pork sausage.

Top o-the line small deli, surprisingly spacious.

Great for quick bite, small groups, and solo dining.
author: McCracken C.

description: This place is a favorite of mine just because its close to my school and its the only decent burger place around. The Bacon Cheeseburger is a perfect fit of mine because the meat is cooked just right,cheese,tomatoes, onions,and comes with crispy fries. Its also quick and cheap too..Lol what does JB's stand for I wonder, could it stand for deliciousness.. Hpmh. The only complaints I have are is sometimes the table can be a little dirty, but besides that nothing else, Honestly I should stop following the hype of my school, but this place is just too GOOd!.
author: Brent L.

description:
A standard deli that does the job. It's a nice, "I want a quick lunch out of the office" place but not a "I want a long, relaxing lunch away from the office" place.

If it's a nice day, grab a sandwich or salad here and plop down at the park a block away.

My fave: the chicken salad with roasted veggies. It takes them a while to make, but it's big and worth the money.
author: Ross A.

description:
One of the BEST deli shops in SF!! A must try!! I've been coming here for a couple of yrs now and have gotten to know the owner, who, is at the register all the time.. that's the homie Nas!! The food is great, prices are superb and the environment is tranquil so read on! 

What I like about this deli is that everything is fresh and everything that they make is delish!! From the sandwiches and burgers, to the salads and special dishes! Prices are cool as well. The one thing that I will say to anyone going to this JB's Place is that from 12pm-1pm (lunchtime) there will be a line, which at times goes out the door (I've witnessed it). You can try calling ahead and placing an order but all in all, it's worth the wait!!  My personal favorites have to be their Grilled Chicken Caesar salad, Spicy Buffalo Chicken Burger and lots of different deli sandwiches! I like this place so much that when the company I work for has our monthly Project Mgr's meeting, I always volunteer to order the lunch, which comes frrooommmmm....??? You guessed it! JB's Place!!!
author: Cesar N.

description: The Food is great, fresh and yummy. Its a great friendly place to grab lunch....But the biggest treat is Nas...He is the owner, and a great guy. Period. Love it there.
author: Pete Nghiem P.

description:
Be careful when ordering over the phone at JBs. I ordered a grilled steak sandwich with meat and cheese only, which I repeated twice when I called in the order. When I arrived to pick it up, I was surprised to find a grilled chicken sandwich with cheese, onions, peppers and mushrooms. Disappointing because that steak sandwich is the main reason I hit up JBs. 

Make sure you get the person taking your order to repeat it back to you!
author: C K.

description:
Try not to go during school lunch hours as this place will be overrun with kids, trying to get away from school. 

That said, when the crowd subsides, what remains is a very cute little hole in the wall with really good burgers. The avocado cheeseburger is busting with just about everything and is a great big mess. Not that it isn't delicious... it's just a great big mess. All burgers come with more fries than you can ever hope to finish. 

I really want to come back to try all the pasta side dishes and the sandwiches.
author: Mariko F.

description: The sandwiches are VERY GOOD. Produce is great. Cashier spends too much time talking with customers when other people need to be helped though.
author: Damon W.

description: Come here almost everyday for lunch! There's no other sandwich place around 17th and Kansas other than Two sons. The owner is nice and so are the workers. Good deli sandwiches. I usually get the turkey on white!
author: Rahul M.

description: If you're looking for a good burger or a bomb breakfast burrito then do yourself a favor and hit this place up. They're a very inexpensive place so if for some freakish reason why you don't like it then at least you didn't spend much money.
author: Michael B.

description:
After years of living in Potrero, I thought I knew every good place to eat in the neighborhood.  But it's been several years since I lived there.  It was a surprise to see JB's Place just around the corner from the park.  Having a banner instead of a real sign made me think the place is new (though it's actually been there for quite a few years now), and the smell of fried onions and other greasy yumminess drew me to the door.  

Sandwiches have generous portions, and they can get pricey if you have a lot of additions (bacon: $1, avocado: $1, cheese, $0.50).  At least they give you quite a bit for the extra dough - I had several strips of bacon, a half cup of mashed avocados, and two slices of cheese.  You can add an order of fries to your sandwich for only a dollar, which is a decent deal.  Sandwiches start around around $5 and go up to $7.25 for the club sandwich.  Great place to pick up a sandwich, whether one of their set ones or a build-your-own.  Nice staff too.

One limited time plus: they have Girl Scout cookies!  All varieties were available when I went by earlier this week.
author: Connie L.

description:
Amid the warehouses of P-Hill lies JB's Place--a neighborhood sandwich shop, serving breakfast, sandwiches, salads, and burgers.  The process from order to payment is dictated by standing in your respective line.

I'd gladly give JB's a higher mark if I had to rely on them on a regular basis, as they seem to be a reliable lunch spot, not to mention, cheap.  But it still doesn't change the fact that their veggie burger was very Burger King-esque.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
What a great little lunch place!  
Not your typical SF overly modern organic nonsense bla bla bla.  Just a solid diner-esque lunch joint, serving up hot and cold sandwich options along with special lunch dishes.  

Friendly service, plenty of table seats, available to-go, lots of drink options (including beer).  The fries are skinny and salty and crispy and the burger is pretty darn tasty.  After too much Giants' game nachos binging, I had the Veggie sandwich, which was like a spinach salad in a pita.  Perfectly seasoned with garlic mayo, it left me satisfied but also wanting more.  Most everything on the menu is under $10, including fries/salad sides.

JB's Place is a place for everyone!
author: Kristin P.

description:
I was first introduced to this little nook of a deli/restaurant in the early 2003. Now I work in the area, and it's like visiting an old friend.

If you are SICK of paying too much for lunch or  dealing with FOO FOO restaurants that are more attitude and price versus good food, then you'll love JBs.

They have the standard deli fare - and even some of the exotics like Gyros or, OMG a "poor boy(?)" sandwich. There's soups, salads, sodas... omg sodas in San Francisco?!

And you can sit down to eat, walk across the street to the park, or hang out on the curb and watch the SWAT team drive by.

JBs is a piece of true San Francisco neighborhood. And if your collar runs blue, you'll enjoy this little breath of fresh air that won't send your wallet into the bay.
author: Percy C.

description: I took my 5 year old here for lunch, it's right around the corner from Jackson Playground in Potrero. He had a grilled cheese and I had falafel wrap. We also shared a package of fresh cut fruit. While appearances make this place look like a run of the mill sandwich/snack shop, everything was surprisingly tasty and made with care. The environment and employees were super friendly. If you get the falafel wrap make sure to get it spicy, the sauce added an excellent dimension to an already solid meal. I want to come back and try more menu items.
author: Dan M.

description: Another vote for JB's place! We went to grab a lunch and had  great service and excellent food. Sandwiches and fries mainly, but very generous portions and well cooked. The place was like an oven on a hot day so we decided to take away, if it had been cooler I would have liked to stay and savour the atmosphere. If I am ever in the area again I will be straight back for the steak sandwich again.
author: Neville M.

description:
Went to Jackson playground with my summercamp and searched sandwiches nearby for my thirty min break.

Came to JB's as it was the closest but I will definitely be back. Ordered a roast beef sandwich as I was in a rush but saw some of the other food as mine was being made and I wish I paid more attention to the menu!  Seriously their food looked bombbb.  Great food, quick service, and reasonable prices! I'm a fan
author: Siobhan T.

description:
This. Place. Rocks! 

You may find yourself a bit overwhelmed when you walk in as there are so many amazing options to choose from....but fear not my friend, I've never had a meal that was less than incredible!  So no matter what you try you're sure to fall in love just as I have.

They're cheap, fast (even when the line is out the door), friendly, and best of all their food is high quality all around goodness. I usually go for the special of the day but their gyros and chicken cesear salads are my other go to dishes that always satisfy.
author: Kristy M.

description:
My coworkers let me in on this little secret.  I've been working in the Hill for about a year and can't believe that I've never been here before.  The place is a bit small and can get crowded quite easily so I suggest getting your food to go.  They make every sandwich fresh and to your specifications.  I ordered the daily special which was a Buffalo Chicken Burger.  I added bacon, pepperjack cheese as well as have them put it on a Dutch Crunch roll rather than a hamburger bun.  The chicken was crispy, the roll was perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside and the fresh veggies were crisp and delicious.  They also piled on a huge side of fries, which I didn't need but ate anyway :) 

I will definitely go back as the food and service were both excellent.  I am already looking forward to my next sandwich adventure.
author: dave k.

description: This place is amazing! Thank goodness I have amazing coworkers or else I never would have found this place. I had the avocado sandwich and it was bombbb. The service is friendly and pleasant, and you can tell it's a place where they try to know their customers. Very decently priced ($5.50?) and the sandwich was so huge it lasted me two meals!
author: Allison S.

description:
Not a bad little sandwich shop.  After living in the neighborhood for several years JB's Place has been closed every day we've gone by.  We know that's because we're really not the target market here.  Its open from 6am to 4pm Monday through Friday so I just haven't been awake in the neighborhood a when they are open.  Today I was up early so I went for breakfast with my wife and ordered the churizo and egg plate with hash brown.    Both we're decent and well made.  Neither were spectacular but they were large portions and good.  coffee was average but drinkable.  Typical restaurant coffee,  If you like the local roaster type coffee you won't like it.  But if you normally drink Starbucks,  it'll be fine.   

JB's is clean and nicely decorated, simple cafe style, nothing fancy. If you are looking for a quick place to grab a simple bite, you can do much worse than JB's.
author: Michael D.

description:
I go to JB's when I'm hungry and want to eat a lot of good food at a reasonable price. I love the turkey burger, the tuna melt, and the spinach omelet (might be my favorite omelet in SF). Also, the salad plate is probably one of the best deals in the city.

I think my favorite thing about JB's though is that it doesn't have the fancy attitude that you get at a lot of places in the city. It's kind of a deli and kind of a greasy spoon, and there isn't any pretense about it. All of the people at JB's are down to earth, genuinely nice folks, and I like spending my money with them.

Oh, and the fries are really good.
author: Mr. B.

description: I recently went to JB's only to discovered it was shut down by the health department. It was graded C in cleanliness by the health department. I'm about to throw up.
author: Ariana C.

description:
Tasty bagel breakfast sandwichs! How come someone up the hill (I live @ 20th) can't do this? Or maybe I'm using the right code words up there?!?  ;-)

Was my first time here and I'll definitely come back. If they had a menu on the wall I must have missed it. Service was a little distracted, but they were working on a large lunch pre-order.
author: Andrew C.

description: I have never ordered anything from JB's that I wasn't completely satisfied with. The staff is very helpful and friendly.Nasir the owner, always has a smile and interacts with all of his customers! My only complaint if you get there during the lunch rush you may not be able to dine in. :)
author: Lois C.

description:
Excellent food at a good price. My co-workers recommended this place to me after they found out that I spend entirely too many days a week at Ganim's for burgers.

This place is your typical deli/sandwich place, but what they offer is some of the best sandwiches, burger and salads for the price. PLUS, you have to try their daily hot special. I just had their baked chicken and it was simply masterful. With a good helping of salad and a side of rice, it was just perfect.

On top of all the good food, the people there are just the friendliest and most efficient helpers around. You wouldn't believe how fast the line moves in there during lunch time, yet you never feel like you're being ignored. Pretty impressive.

I'm really looking forward to trying your breakfast soon.
author: Jim T.

description:
switched to the Bacon, Egg and Cheers (on english muffin)

it's bomb. slap some Tapatio on that and get a half order of fries with it... All you need.
author: Sam H.

description:
Talk about a great mom & pop place! I work right around the corner and can't say enough great things about JBs. Sure, it's not haute cuisine, but for the price, I think they offer terrific value--good sized portions and homestyle cooking that changes daily. (Love the specials!) They're the kind of place where they know you by name and are always willing to chit chat. 

And to all the healthy nayseasers: sure, ain't the healthiest food you'll ever eat, but its surely a step above greasy spoon diners! (how many diners serve homemade ceviche?!) and you can definitely find healthier options (great salads, pasta salads, etc.)

A few of my favorites:

-Buffalo Chicken Burger (awesome!)
-Meatball grinder
-Ceviche! (a must try)
-Baked Chicken
-Pork Chops
-Turkey sandwich

Say hi to Nas and Reem when you go in and you'll have friends for life!
author: Andrew C.

description:
its a cool lil neighborhood spot and the samiches are good.  since my regular burger joint was closed for renovations i came to JB's.  now i really had a hankerin for a fat ass burger wit mushrooms and bacon.  so that s what i ordered.  when the food came about 20 minutes later i realized that my burger was a frozen patty.  totally turned me off.  like i said...the samiches are good but the burgers were a total disappointment...use fresh ground chuck wit your fresh veggies.  

so i took 2 stars for the time it took during my 1 hr lunch and the fact that it was frozen food...yukkkkkkkkk!!!
author: Bane V.

description:
Simple sandwhiches. A great price. Right by work. I like it. 

I'd recommend the Po' Boy.
author: Roderic C.

description: Im torn about my rating. The service is great and I love the sandwiches but the muffins they carry are the worst. The blueberry is like a thick piece of dough. Very dry and not flavorful. Very disappointed.
author: Neal C.

description: Love this place! Food is great and there is a lot of variety. Best Turkey Burger of my life. And, cheap!
author: Karie S.

description: Recently went again and ordered the BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich = FTW!!!!!!!!!
author: Jean T.

description: This is a great neighborhood lunch place. I had the cheeseburger and french fry combo. Tip: call in your order to avoid the wait.
author: Cameron K.

description: Great food and great service. Nasa is such a nice guy, the kids love stopping by to say hi.
author: D W.

description:
Don't you hate it when you only have an hour lunch break and you're trying to figure out where to eat with a bunch of your coworkers?  Someone is craving a turkey sandwich, while another is craving a burger.  Nobody can make up their damn mind and...oh wait, we just spent 10 minutes debating on where to go.  Great!  Now there's only 50 minutes left.

The best solution (for those that work close by), is JB's.  The food here is AMAZING, cheap, and fresh.  They pretty much have everything: burgers, pasta, sandwiches, falafel wraps, baked potato, salads, soup, cookies, steak over rice (today's special), etc.  You can't really go wrong.  

The staff's nice and the line is tolerable. 

+5, no complaints so far.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: This is one of our very few options for lunch around work, and is totally solid, sandwich/burger type lunch food. I usually get either a hot pastrami sandwich, or a veggie delight, and am never disappointed.
author: Kay M.

description:
This place was a pleasant surprise for a work lunch.  A coworker suggested we check it out and walking up I thought it was going to be another pricey niche deli that served just sandwiches.  The first thing I noticed when we walked in was someone that had french fries-a huge plus for any deli.  What I discovered once inside is this place is much more than a deli.

We both ordered one of the daily specials and it was the buffalo chicken sandwich with fries or salad.  Fries of course!  The sandwich was amazing and the service was friendly and quick.  Parking was easy down the block at the big park.

There is a huge selection of beverages, including two sizes of Orangina-one of my favorites.

Overall, a good experience and a nice surprise.  I'll go back soon.
author: Curtis C.

description: JB's is awesome.  If you're in this area, it's a great place to lunch at.  The people are nice, the service is fast, the price is cheap, and most of all the food is DELICIOUS.  I rotate between two regulars:  the tri-tip sandwich with cheese and a side of fries or the cheeseburger (fries included).  Both get two thumbs up and the fries, like others have mentioned, are addicting.  Come hungry.
author: Joe M.

description:
JB's has the winning combination:

Good food, great service, great selection, and very reasonable prices.

If you haven't, try their french fries.  My coworkers and I call them "crack fries."

Seriously, I don't know what it is about this place, the food or the service, but sometimes I think about driving across the city just for a sandwich from them.
author: Gavin S.

description: Nice spot with a full staff, and variety, variety.  Talking about variety of deli salads like Whole Foods or a Safeway, bottled drinks, sandwiches, and burgers.  Its small, and close to a hole in a wall, but definitely has a local feel to it.  Not overly decorated, but just simple and solely based on food and options.  You even have candy bars and chips sold by the cashier, so how "corner store" is that.   A lot of locals come during lunch to fill their tummies.  They serve breakfast till 11 a.m. and lunch.  Limited seating though, get there before noon if you want to grab a seat.  My friend ordered the special.  It was a pork loin sandwich with fries.  He said it wasn't too bad.  I had the tuna melt with cheddar and fries.  Its a tuna melt, so I can't bitch.  Though I got a honest tea with it and it came out to $8. 50. Was hoping they would throw fries in there for me, but it cost an extra buck.  Very clean spot and cute.  Definitely a go to spot to drop by if your craving a regular sandwich or burger, but that's it. . . .food is regular, so that's why I'm giving it an ok.
author: Janice F.

description: Great place to pick up a quick lunch.  Had a turkey on sourdough. Service is fast and the place is no frills. Portion size is good. Worked out in a pinch since we didn't have time to try Plow before our tour at Anchor Brewery
author: Chanda E.

description:
I needed to fill my gullet because it was 10am and I hadn't eaten a thing! While at Concentra for PT around the corner, I asked what was close and they pointed me here....Whoa!  Waaaay above my expectations for this industrial area...but perfect none the less. 
I still wanted breakfast and asked them to make me an egg, cheese and sausage sandwich. The cook looked for someone to help him interpret, and found Nasser the owner to pinch hit the translation. Then he asked me what kind of bread. I wanted it on a bagel...so he pointed me towards the register, where there were prepackaged bagels with cream cheese. 
I peered at him quizzically and he assured me that he'd remove the cream cheese. It was weird, but in this day and age of over-consumption  and waste...not being a fan of dairy...I appreciated the reuse of the bagel. I'm not always this forgiving but was in a better mood than usual I guess. 
I also ordered a latte with soy. There was a nice mini ravioli with pesto salad that I grabbed for dinner later. The total for all of this was $10.50.
The portions were grand...it is in an industrial area...boyz want to walk away feeling full and JBs hit the mark for that. I think it was well priced and the quality of the ingredients seemed above average. It kills me to see illegals working in these places...but it is what it is. For their part they did an excellent job and keep the place very clean and tidy. 
The decor is sleek industrial with beech laminate cabinets to warm up the space. It comfortably seats about 15 patrons...but don't quote me on that.
I'll be back and enjoy another one of their amazing displays of salads next time.
author: Ida Slapter D.

description:
My go to lunch spot. The owner is one of the nicest dudes that you can imagine. Basic deli food, but really consistent and SUPER CLEAN. I would give them 5, but sometimes it takes a little longer than you would expect and it's a little bit of a pain when there are 6 people crowded around the cash register in no particular order.
Go for the Buffalo chicken Burger and the Poorboy
author: J M.

description:
If you ever want some bacon lovin', then this is your place. Dieters beware, there are probably two items you can order here that will not blow your meal plan: low fat yogurt and diet soda. Then again, when we at work order from JB's, we are already in a mental place where it'll take a BLT with cheese and avocado (no need to report this to the American Heart Association), meatball sandwich, or grilled chicken caesar salad to lower our stress level. We always order at least one item that has bacon in it since this is one of the rare places that'll cook its bacon until crispy. 

My only complaint for the food is the quality of their fries. I like my fries a 3 to 1 ratio of crispy to soft. There also needs to be salt on the fries right when it comes out of the fryer so that the salt is a part of the fry. The fries here are all soggy and not salted. You'll have to add your own salt. Think Carl's Jr. fries so beware if you don't like Carl's Jr. fries. I suppose the benefit to the bad fries is that you won't be tempted to get it in addition to your order. 

The owners of this place are nice to their customers. They try to get to know their customers, if there's not a long line of course. Call your oder in ahead of time to avoid the wait. Don't expect to always find parking right in front. There seem to be a lot of days where people just don't work and hog up all the surrounding parking spots on a weekday lunch time.
author: Gwen L.

description:
Great lunch spot for those who work nearby. They offer a variety of everything "lunch", it seems. The prices are reasonable & portions are big. Perfect for getting you into that after-lunch coma at work. I ordered the daily special here last time (roast chicken + sides), and really enjoyed it. The flavors and presentation of the dish was very cafeteria-like, in a good way. The people who work there are really nice too...in fact, their friendliness is one of the lasting impression this place always leaves with me.

Dining area is decently sized. Good for a small group of co-workers to come for a casual lunch. Not necessarily the newest or hippest thing in the city, but sometimes, when simplicity will do, JB's makes for an excellent choice.
author: Rona J.

description:
Here's why i'm giving JB's 5 stars:

This place is an oasis of 'grub' in a vast neighborhood of 'cuisine'. man, i love a good sandwich, and this place makes great sandwiches, of classic deli fare. No fancy fare, the sandwiches are great and the descriptions are just the usual 'on rye with mayonaise and pickles' and not 'served on a family-made multi grain traditional bread, with aoili and gerkins..'
While i truly enjoy fine dining, this place does what it does best: feed me a (huge) piping hot (delicious) sandwich, they do it fast, and they are friendly. I couldn't possibly ask for more in a lunchtime, desperate for reprieve from CCA's cafe and Wolf's.
author: meredith b.

description: Great cheap sandwiches. My favorite is meatloaf and meatball sandwiches. The service is pretty fast and they have a great range of drinks.
author: Yan Yan M.

description: Nice little sandwich shop in Potrero Hill. I have worked within a few blocks of this place for 3 years and have enjoyed getting sandwiches here once every few weeks. The staff are all great and the food is delish- but there isn't much more than sandwiches, burgers, salads and some breakfast food. BUT if you are in the mood for those things this place is perfect.
author: Kate M.

description:
I bring my lunch to work 95% of the time. But some days I'm either too lazy to get it together in the morning, or I just don't feel like eating what I brought from home. On these days, I go to JBs.

Last week I was feeling lousy, so one of my coworkers brought back some soup for me. Damn! It was really good, and I'm saying that as someone who used to make soup for a living (really). This was real soup, soup like your mom made. Soup without pretensions. 

Everyone here is super friendly, and even when there is a line, it goes fast.
author: Kristen H.

description: It's close to my office. I got a great deal on Google Offers and decided to give it a try. Got the pulled pork sandwich with french fries. A pretty big sandwich and a good amount of fries. The prices are reasonable. Will let the office know.
author: V. P.

description:
Before there was Whole Foods Potrero Hill, there was JB's Place. And don't you forget it!

This is a local sandwich joint for people who don't mind waiting in line. Who like American cheese. Who eat donuts. Who put Tapatio hot sauce on their eggs. Who are like me.

(They have salads too...)
author: Danny E.

description: Discovered this place with coworker and wish we had found it earlier! Loved our sandwiches and will definitely be back!
author: Lulu S.

description:
I work in the area, I go for lunch sometimes, I eat the veggie burger and fries and avocado sandwich, I chat with the nice people behind the counter, I enjoy.  

The guy and his wife who run the cash register are very, very nice.  Even nice to the rambling alcoholic man I saw ramble in and, um, ramble something incoherent about...something that had to do with coming back the next day?  Hm.  The owner nodded a "whatever" nod, politely, all three times in response to the rambler's promise to come back the next day.  That got to me.  THEY'RE NICE TO BUMS!  I'm giving this place my business forever.

And their little kids running around are cute, too.  They need my money for their college funds.

And the food--it's pretty good!  

Great selection. (Even Jumbo containers of fresh fruit slices. Nice.)

Fast service. 

Get your buns in there and be nice to the bums with them.  It's a family affair, yo.  It's a small world.
author: Kim I.

description:
There are three reasons why I keep coming back to JB's:

1. It's a block away from my work.
2. The people here are incredibly friendly. They make you feel right at home. 
3. The black forest ham sandwich on ciabatta bread with pesto garlic mayo and grilled red onions. This is one of their daily specials so I never have any idea when they have it but damn, it's GOOD. I find myself daydreaming about this sandwich. 

Thank you JB's for killing my productivity after work because I'm in a massive food coma.
author: Patrick L.

description:
How nice are the people that work here?! I just love that!

We had 2 customized veggie delights and everything was very fresh, which is all you really need to do with a veggie sandwich. Well, that and have a lot of things to put in it. 

They have a huge selection of drinks & have fries & bags of chips so you can really pimp out your lunch. 

Today, that is really all I needed. Thanks JB!
author: Shal J.

description: love the chef salad, fruit salad has been perfect 95% of the time (hence 4 stars and not 5..) grilled chicken caesar, and the ham & cheese omelette is phenomenal.
author: Abigail W.

description: JB's is one of my favorite places to eat! If you come here you have to try there grilled steak sandwich. The workers here are nice and friendly. There's never a time where i had a bad experience at this place. The only thing is that they close at 4 and there closed on the weekend. If they open alittle bit longer and at least open on the weekends I would be coming here more often.
author: Jranel F.

description:
I only recently discovered this great back-to-the-basics deli, but I've been going bi-weekly ever since, each time finding some new unaccounted gem to appreciate either in food or experience.  JB's is somewhat off the beaten path in the Portrero district, but the 22 bus rolls right past (although I would not recommend riding for even one stop on this hell-bound cesspool of degenerate fifth, especially if trying to build an appetite,) and also nearby are the California Culinary Academy and Whole Foods.  (Connecticut Yankee and Thee Parkside are also within a few blocks if you need a beer on the patio to wash down your sandwich.)  

I must admit that I cannot really offer the most encompassing review of JB's, since I get pretty much the same sandwich every time, but damn is this sandwich good!  Turkey on dutch crunch with provolone and everything-- boom.  This is now my deliciously simple and plain lunch hour favorite.  It always comes perfectly wrapped and intact, the veggies and meat evenly distributed, no frilly toothpicks or any of that. A sandwich is such a simple thing that it's really the subtleties that distinguish a great one.  At JB's they have a way of assembling theirs so that it's the perfect union of care and chaos; you can tell they were thrown together quickly, but with attention to proportion and arrangement.  One time I made the mistake of requesting light on the mayo, like I was going to crack a dent in my 4,000 calorie/day diet with that small and random revision, and it actually tasted dry.  I still could see little traces of white though, so I knew it was there, they didn't just disregard the ingredient altogether like most places.  I like that attention to detail, and the lack of pretentiousness.  No herby aioli spreads, no foreign cheeses I can't pronounce-- just a good old turkey sandwich.  

The staff is also extremely friendly, the lines move fast, and my food has always been ready in less than the time they've promised.  A nice clean interior with a good drink selection too.
author: Dana C.

description: Bombdiggity sammies and burgers -  super tasty salads/sides - potato salad is pure win.
author: Roger C.

description: The sandwiches here are average. The meat is of below average quality and the sauce is too heavy on the mayonnaise. There's nothing special about this place except the convenient location next to my office.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I like this place, 
I get the baked potatoes at lunch time,
they are really nice and put what I want on the potato
its tasty
reasonably priced, 
they use recyclable paper in the "to go" containers.
they have one table outside.
it looks like they take phone orders.
I know they take credit cards

if your in the area and want a fast lunch, 
this is your place.
author: adam m.

description:
I work around the corner from JBs and pretty much get lunch there everyday. I like the variety of the specials. Food is pretty good! The staff is very friendly. They also go out of their way to remember your name. 

JBs is packed at lunch everyday if you need any more proof that it rocks. :)
author: Lawrence S.

description:
Quick and easy, kinda dirty (in a good way) burger spot right at the base of Potrero Hill.  When you enter you get corralled along like you would at the short order grill at some college dorm eatery, ahh the memories of rubbing up against various folk in my quest for burger.  The prices are pretty spot on for San Francisco with the big burger (it has some name that I forget) and a beverage running me on the high end of 10 dollars.  The burger came with a Huge amount of fries that are also pretty damn tasty, but it is most likely that you can not finish them all.
The burger itself was really good, much better than I expected with lots of fresh toppings and a sublime balance of meat to cheese to bacon to avocado to whatever else was slathered up there.  The bread was the perfect amount of chewy and moist to absorb some of the juicy juice.
They do sandwiches as well and although they seem to have quite a wide selection of foods I have to say that the burger is where its at.  Love JB's and most certainly will be returning.  Oh, yea they don't have that much seating inside but there is a really nice park just down the block that works well for picnic style burgerizing (bring napkins)
author: Kenneth H.

description:
the sandwiches and burgers are great - no surprise there.

but their breakfast burritos are legit.  i call in (even though it only takes about 5 mins to make) so i can wake up as late as possible. mmm... 

it's delicious and doubles as a means for making sure your abdominals have zero definition.
author: eric f.

description:
Fifty feet away from my office door, this often is the default solution for lunch. Most of the time I (or at least my arteries) end up regretting the choice. Definitely not the place for folks watching their cholesterol or attempting to live somewhat healthy. And some of the specials are definitely suspect.

So why three stars?
For one, the people running the place are incredibly nice. But the main reason is that they've saved me from losing my job! Their breakfast sandwich (try scrambled egg and ham on whole wheat toast) is the ultimate hangover cure. It's the little miracle that many times has turned the disheveled, pathetic wreck stumbling off the bus into a productive, smiling employee of the month.

Can't beat that with a stick!
author: Tatjana G.

description:
Truth is, I literally live right around the corner from JB's.  The staff is as friendly as you'll ever meet, they're very much apart of the neighborhood.

I've lived on the hill for 8 years any only discovered them last year when I left the corporate world and worked from home for a bit, now that I have me one of those regular jobs again where I have to go into an office and I'm kinda bummed because I can't get my breakfast burrito or hot pastrami sandwich any 'ol time... 

Ok time to fess' up, sometimes I tell my boss I have to work from home so I can eat lunch there.  There I said it, and if I get my butt canned then I can eat all of the turkey and avocado I want. Really I'd be ok with that.
author: Mateo E.

description: Like everyone else has noted, I think this place has everything on their menu...except for maybe a chocolate milkshake? Man, they're pretty friendly I'd bet they would make one for you if you asked...Decently priced for, quick good food. Hard to beat.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Best sandwiches in SF hands down. The owner and his staff are all great. I am gluten free so I have to bring in my own bread. They don't make a big deal about it and they always make me an amazing, amazing sandwich. Breakfast is also amazing. The prices are awesome. I just really love this place.
author: Candace C.

description: I came here for breakfast on the recommendation of a person who works in the area!  So glad I took the advice.  My omelet was great.  Everything was fresh and nice!
author: Anthony L.

description: If I didnt have to watch my weight I would probably eat here every day. I love the veggie options like the portabello burgers, the fries are TO DIE FOR, and they have really good sides like orzo salads! My co workers had the burgers and are now also a big fan. you can sit outside and enjoy the sun and the owner is nice. Cant wait to go back after Ive worked off my last visit!
author: M K.

description: Super nice place to go for lunch. Not open on weekends, but open early on weekdays. Great place to grab a sandwich before heading to work in the morning. They have fantastic specials that change daily. Breakfast burritos are hearty. Their Thai noodle salad is delicious. Very clean, friendly and the employees are fun and service oriented. a few small tables for dining in. most orders are to go.
author: Leon L.

description:
easily one of the best sandwich/burger shops in potrero! they've also got some great daily specials: soups and salads, beef stew, spag & meatballs or spicy buffalo chicken sandwiches.

whatever you choose you can't go wrong with jb's, modest price point, always fresh, great selection!
author: alex m.

description: So far we're off on the wrong foot.  I struggled with your menu...not terribly veggie friendly.  Strike one was the caesar salad, which came dressed and with warm chicken on it altho I definitely ordered it NO chicken.  It made the whole salad warm and slimey.  Btdubs, who dresses a to-go salad?  Strike two is the mysterious cobb salad that has been different both times I've ordered it.  Of course chefs can take creative license on what they use in their dishes, but doesn't a cobb salad have avocado, egg & blue cheese?  I'm confused as to why you're calling it a cobb if it doesn't come with any of those things.  You're close to work, that's really the only reason I went back after the greasy caesar.  I'm not sure I'm gonna go for that third strike, I think you're already out, JB's.
author: Emily T.

description: So good! I order from here for work and today finally tried their falafel. It's tasty, crispy, and served at just the right temperature. Really good green tabbouleh too. The people here are beyond friendly and helpful, and I just noticed that they've started using TaterWare to go containers - 100% biodegradable and GMO free. Maybe you have to make special requests to get this type of container for salads and sandwiches, because some came in it and some didn't, so ask when you go. All in all, this is a fantastic place for everyday lunch.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Great fries. Grilled steak sandwich was basically a cheesesteak, except that I would have preferred provolone or something else besides American.
author: Rob T.

description: order the gyro . . . ORDER THE GYRO!!!!  Oh man, their tzatziki sauce is so delicious and cucumbery, dripping over the seasoned strips of meat, tomatoes, and onion onto the fluffy pita bread.  I ate mine in approximately 45 seconds.  I preceded it with a rice crispy treat to give my other dining partners a leg up but Suchie has a tapeworm and the other is polite so they still had to pack their meals to go.  Suchie raved about her salmon burger (how could they do this to salmon?!) and we all munched on the delicious thin french fries.  Their ketchup is very piquant (vinegary).
author: Elena S.

description:
Solid workday food in non hilly Lower Portero / SoMa border
Always wanted to check this place out while pedalling by, and today was the day

Not quite as good as Ted's Market, but not disappointing either
Owners (or who I assume are owners) are fairly young and thus not worn out and tired (like Crockery Cafe )
There are other workers who primarily assemble the food, they didn't seem too angry to be working there and that's always a good thing
Price was reasonable (a little more than Teds, Crock or Wolfe's)
Food was fresh,
Nice comprehensive selection of breads
Absent was any wall menu (just a specials white board with barely any items on it)
A lot of the food and prep is done in the back, so you don't get to see what they have before you order (always good to see the hot food specials first)
I got a tuna melt for 6.78 including tax
Worth checking out if you live or work there, or if you're curious or driving thru (kind of in between 280 and 80)
Worthy enough to be added to my Outer SoMa A-list
http://www.yelp.com/list_details?favorites_list_id=6r8z7Xfesmq16FFD73F5gQ&fsid=V5eOLddzyeVeNfs3Loi6fA
You'll probably need a bicycle to get there from some areas of outer soma, unless you walk fast
They also boast about being on yelp

TIP: Avoid good there during school let out time, there are many in the immediate vicinity and I think I saw a few spitballs flying
author: G K.

description: At the far end of my lunch range lies JB's Place, one of those quick-and-dirty-lunch-counter establishments in the vein of Wolfe's or Crockery Cafe.  Decor's nicer than most, with a clean modern look balanced by warm yellow walls.  The menu is suspiciously broad, and I doubt they can do everything on it very well.  But it is heavily centered on sandwiches, so they're probably a safe bet.  I decided to go with the daily special, Chicken Marsala, which has a notorious tendency at cheap places to taste like school cafeteria food.  But to JB's credit, it was actually pretty good.  Props on having Honest Tea in the beverage case!
author: Wes M.

description: There is something so nice about going to a place where they know your name and they even remember what you like to eat. I'm sad with the recent remodeling they've gotten rid of some of my favorites like philly chicken cheese sandwich but I love that they have range from super healthy veggie food to good old fashion burgers. The new decor will be sure to attract the new hipsters that have moved in with the condo into our neighborhood but to me they will always be a nice family run business that doesn't overcharge and are always super friendly.
author: DeathandFood H.

description: Very nice staff, all the way around.  They have daily specials which are usually nice warm comfort food,  The grill is OK, the sandwiches are good, the salads are average.  Nice selection of cold drinks.
author: Michael A.

description: I've been going to J.B.'s for the past 7 years or so and have probably tried everything they've got.  My usual is the Patty Melt which is awesome, especially if you're down with the classic grease.  The salads are good as well and the servers are fast and friendly. Lunchtime can produce long lines that stretches near the entrance.  They've recently did a remodel and its looks great.  The prices are reasonable and the sandwiches are good as well. Give them a try!
author: Milton W.

description: A little hole in the wall deli that'll surprise ya!  Not much to look at but they make a decent sandy and a fantastic chicken caesar, with sauteed chicken, onions, & peppers in a barely there scrumptious dressing.  It's huge and filling!  Pretty good side salads such as tortellini & sun-dried tomato, crab, and macaroni.  The owners are dolls and the joint always has someone in it.  A hood staple!
author: Tara G.

description:
this place gets 5 stars for having PIBB IN A CAN!!!!!
i haven't seen it in a week or so, but it was pretty amazing to find that.

they have a pretty good falafel sandwich.  they make their sandwiches like you always wished your mom did.  big, fat and perfectly delicious.  
oh yeah and they have a really good vegan banana walnut chocolate chip cookie...so good
author: cate d.

description: Great place for lunch! I'm a little disappointed by the renovation. It makes me feel like I'm in my overdone college dining hall. But the food continues to be amazing. I love the egg salad sandwich, which is perfect for making me fall into a post-lunch coma.
author: Kathleen M.

description: i used to work next door ... when we moved into that space i was kinda bummed because jb's looks kinda underwhelming ... from the outside.  so many things in that part of town are underwhelming from the outside ... as it turns out, the folks at jb's are pretty awesome.  this is not a fancy outfit, but the staff at jb's serves up tasty lunchtime grub.  it'd be sweet to have something like this where i work now.
author: Henry M.

description:
this place gets pretty busy at lunch time.  they do classic deli sandwiches... but their ingredients reminds me of subway, and i hate subway.  they have a lot of variety of bread here, which is always a plus.  the guy over the counter was really nice and made my custom sandwich to order (dutch crunch, eggplants, red peppers, provolone, and vinaigrette dressing).  
i know, i'm a pretty bossy person.  so for putting up with me, this deli gets 4 stars. 
oh they also have really good fruit salads and in large portions for only $3.50.
author: H. L.

description: This is a good sandwich shop.  It was described to my friends and I as a "working class sandwich" as we asked a group of ladies walking out.  Still a little unsure of what that meant, but the sandwiches are good none the less.  I've had their tuna, roast beef and turkey.  All with different fixings.  The dining area is surprisingly big for a sandwich shop in the city, so it provides for a comfortable place to get away from work and watch a little television.  The service is friendly and you can have your order customized as they put it together.
author: R B.

description: so many vegetarian options. and vegan even. Falafal- wrap or sandwhich; boca burger, egg salad, avocado sandwhich... every kind of salad. everything here is good. nicest people.  basically every beverage you would want to drink with your meal. packets of tapatio! to take with you and cigarettes. i think they thought of everything. and girl scout cookies from the bosses daughter.
author: jessica s.

description: The service is so nice here! Not extraordinarily different than any other sandwich shop, but no complaints either.
author: Sophie D.

description: We ordered 10 sandwiches to go for a lunch meeting. Despite the fact that we were charged for 10 sandwiches, they forgot one and I ended up starving the whole time. If you get a to go order from them, make sure to count!
author: Colin S.

description: BLT was pretty darn good.  Add avocado...
author: Robert M.

description:
It's a great little sandwich place.  Nothing fancy, but good breakfast sandwiches. 

Wish they had longer hours and better weekend hours, but oh well.
author: D D.

description: this place is good except they take a long time making food. You should call ahead with your order if you are in a rush. The staff is very friendly. They make good bacon egg and cheese. The environment is nice and makes you want to sit there and read a paper with a cup of joe and your yummy food.
author: J S.

description: have i already yelped this place?  dunno.  so, just in case.  i love this place.  lots and lots of yummy fresh food.  they seem to be making salads every morning when i stop in for my fried egg sandwich on a roll with am cheese, which isn't quite like the ones i used to get in nyc, but it's proabably fresher and better.  today i tried a salad.  yum.  no surprise.  next?  deviled eggs.  wow.
author: Sarah P.

description: ohhh jb's how you brighten my day with your delicious burgers, falafel and awesome staff.  The folks who run/work at JBs are the BEST.  Really good comfort foods at a decent price- quick and happy service...basically, JB's is my favorite deli in the city.
author: Biscuit C.

description: great sandwiches- great service.  Family-owned and operated, this place is a cheap and yummy spot for deli sandwiches, burgers, desserts... Take your lunch and have a picnic at the park- just a block away!
author: jackie a.

description: This place is awesome, the people who work there can't get any nicer. They make the best lattes and the sandwiches are nothing short of yummy! I'm never going to Starbucks in the mornings again!
author: Sarai S.

description:
Great Service... Good Food... How much better can you get?  

I go to JB's for lunch about once a week and every thing there is good.  I love that they have daily hot specials.  The service is always friendly ... "where everybody knows you name" ... type of service.  Try it.. you'll like it!
author: Nancy F.

description: JB's Place is a great, underline, great, lunch place.  Some of the best sandwiches you can find.  I'm a sucker for hot pastrami.  Very friendly service.  I haven't had breakfast here yet, but I stop in for coffee some times, and the coffee is normal diner coffee, nothing about which to rave.  Did I mention they have damn good sandwiches? And soups too.
author: Jeremiah R.

description: I love JBs. I used to work about two blocks from this place. I dont anymore, but i  find myself going way out of my way to go here.  I must say that I am totally in love with their breakfast burittos, omlettes and chicken salad. Good Eats for the right price. And the people that work there are super friendly. They always make it a welcome, and warm experience.
author: John R.

description: I love this place!!!  Nasar & Reem (sp?) are the best!!  I recently used their service to cater an event at our office (since they are in the neighborhood) and they went above and beyond the call of duty for us!  We will use them 99% of the time (they don't serve Chinese food, so we got to go somewhere else sometimes.)  Don't underestimate what they are capable of doing.  From simple to amazingly beautiful platters, they adjusted according to our clients needs.  They are always friendly and the staff is well equipped to get you in and get you out with out feeling like you were pushed.  2 thumbs up to this hidden treasure!!!  BTW, they deliver!!!!
author: Elaine C.

description: Not that J.B.'s needs any help here, but damn do they put out some good food. Their deli is always extremely fresh, and their hot foods never disappoint. Whether you're interested in a straight up burger, falafel, gyro, or turkey sandwich, you can't go wrong. The best of all, they do phone orders for pickup.
author: Dan B.

description: JB's Is the Best! Friendly Staff , close to walk from work Great service!
author: J D.

description: the guys behind the deli could be a little bit friendlier...i think they hate gay people...or their job...they just seemed annoyed and over it every time I'm there...
author: Sancho P.

description: The cheese bagels here are what keep me alive.  My day does not feel right if I don't get that cheesey goodness in my belleh.  Also the staff is always friendly and they make you feel right at home.  Actually, better than that because I don't have cheese bagels at my home.
author: pierre m.
